entry.title: Combined summary - A proposal for up-front payments.
entry.summary: The Lightning Network mailing list is currently discussing proposals to address jamming attacks on the network. Some of the proposals being discussed include reversing payment directions and adding grace periods. However, during these discussions, there have been concerns raised about privacy and state machine complexity. There was also criticism for the fast-fail mechanism for HTLCs. Developers are proposing a new payment scheme that features up-front payments to prevent Type 2 spam and eliminate costless attacks. The discussion also explored ways to reduce latency and increase efficiency by adding a grace period for payments and creating a new protocol for HTLC forwarding. Another issue that was addressed during the discussion was dropped channels and peer disconnection. Proposed solutions included updating channel states regularly and generating nonces from prepayment hashes. Additionally, the concern of bandwidth costs being paid for by the payment itself was raised.During the discussion, the proper functioning of payment routing using an HTLC onion packet was discussed in detail. Suggestions were made to obscure path length and prevent spam. Overall, the discussion showed that there are many challenges facing the Lightning Network, but there are also many potential solutions being proposed.
